EDUCATION 

Doctoral Degree Programme in Computer Science and Engineering,2021  University of Oulu, Finland. Research Advisor: Dr. Denzil Ferreira

Master of Science (Technology) Computer Science and Engineering, June 2018 University of Oulu, Finland

  • 126 ECTS credits completed 
  • Master’s thesis graded excellent 
  • Master’s thesis supervised by Dr Denzil Ferreira and Dr Simo Hosio 
  • Average degree grade of 4.41 (very good) 

Bachelor of Science (Computer Science), June 2011 Kwame Nkrumah University of Science and Technology, Ghana

  • 145 credits completed 
  • Bachelor’s thesis graded A (70% and above) 
  • Final cumulative weighted average of 68.84 (2nd class upper division)   

 CERTIFICATIONS 

 CITI Program Clinical Research courses under requirements set by University of California, Los Angeles 

  • UCLA HIPAA  
  • Human Research- Biomedical Researchers, valid till September 2021 
  • GCP – Social and Behavioral Research Best Practices for Clinical Research, valid till September 2021   

SKILLS 

  • Android programming, full stack development, data analysis and machine learning using Java, C#.NET, ASP.NET, VB.NET, Python, R, and JavaScript.  
  • Database development and Management using MS SQL, and MySQL  

LINGUISTIC SKILLS 

  • Mother tongue: Twi 
  • Foreign Languages: English (Listening: C2, Reading: C2, Spoken interaction: C2, Spoken production: C2), Finnish (Listening: A2, Reading: A1, Spoken interaction: A1, Spoken production: A1) 

EXPERIENCE 

Doctoral researcher, Center for Ubiquitous Computing, University of Oulu, Finland 

July 2018 – Date  

  • Early stage research on anomalous human behaviour detection using entropy-based methods under the Academy of Finland SENSATE project  

Visiting Research and Development Engineer, Haltian Oy, Oulu, Finland 

May 2018 – August 2018 

  • Continuing research effort on Academy of Finland CARE project, scaling up CARE with Thingsee IOT platform, and building Web APIs for CARE database 

Research Assistant, Center for Ubiquitous Computing, University of Oulu, Finland  

September 2017 – June 2018 

  • Continuing research effort on the Academy of Finland funded CARE project; developing mobile application and conducting field studies.  
  • Master’s thesis research on the BusinessFinland funded S3-Simple Smart Sensor project related to smartphone data sensing from credit card sized NFC powered sensor board. 
  • Teaching assistant in Human Computer Interaction and Mobile and Social Computing course 

University Intern, Center for Ubiquitous Computing, University of Oulu, Finland  

June 2017- August 2017 

  • Assisting the research on the Academy of Finland funded CARE project 
  • Monitoring CARE sensing infrastructure. 
  • Developing the CARE android application using AWARE framework.  

Monitoring and Evaluation (M&E) Consultant, UNICEF, Accra - Ghana  

November 2015 – August 2016 

  • Monitoring and evaluation of Key Performance Indicators of basic sanitation. 
  • Providing technical backstopping, field training and capacity building for BASIS software scale up. 

Software Developer, RITSoft Company Ltd, Accra - Ghana  

August 2012 – December 2015 

  • Full stack developer of software solutions; CSManager, an integrated Fund and loan management system, Pendama, a pension management system, and Mintesaa, a results-based monitoring and evaluation tool. 
  • Providing technical backstopping and training for clients.   

Information Systems Assistant, Student Loan Trust Fund, Accra - Ghana  

October 2011 to July 2012 

  • Full stack developer of software solutions; Attendance management system, and Human Resource Performance Appraisal System.   
  • Providing technical backstopping and training for company staff.    

TEACHING 

  • 2018 Teaching assistant for 521147S Mobile and Social Computing, 5 ECTS credits 
  • 2017, 2018 Teaching assistant for 521145A Human-Computer Interaction, 5 ECTS credits 
  • 2018,2019 Teaching assistant for Applied Computing Project I & II, 8 & 10 ECTS credits 

PRESENTATIONS 

  • "S3: Environmental Fingerprinting with a Credit Card-sized NFC Powered Sensor Board"; Oral presentation at the 20th International Conference on Human-Computer Interaction with Mobile Devices (MobileHCI 2018), Barcelona, Spain, September 2018 

HONOURS AND AWARDS 

  • Distinguished Project Award, 8th International UBI Summer School 2017 Oulu, Finland 

VOLUNTEER AND ORGANISATION WORK 

  • Student Volunteer, 20th International Conference on Human-Computer Interaction with Mobile Devices (2018), Barcelona, Spain 
  • Organising Committee Member and Liaison Student, 9th International UBI Summer School (2018), University of Oulu, Finland
